gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: National: The 'We' (infant formula manufacturer) is interpreted as operating primarily at a National scale. Its 'performance in human rights, labour rights, responsible marketing' would involve adhering to national laws and regulations, even if guided by international principles. The text does not explicitly state multi-country operations for the manufacturer itself.; Transnational: The 'FTSE’s responsible investment index' is a global index that assesses companies across multiple countries against international standards, clearly fitting the Transnational / Cross-border definition.

Full Paragraph Text: We were ranked number one by the charity Oxfam in its 2014 scorecard, Behind the Brands. The survey scored 10 food and beverage companies on their efforts to improve food security.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a ranking by Oxfam of food and beverage companies on food security efforts, but contains no explicit causal relationships between actors operating at different spatial scales. All actors and actions explicitly mentioned operate at the Transnational / Cross-border scale, thus no cross-scale interactions are present.

Full Paragraph Text: The business environment was again marked by great uncertainty in 2014. Disruptive socio-economic and political change continued to affect growth in many parts of the world. In the emerging markets, economic volatility worsened as growth rates slowed and currencies weakened. In the developed markets, deflationary pressures and soft consumer demand resulted in a continued challenging trading environment. In the face of such uncertainty it was more important than ever to stay the course and remain loyal to our strategy, driving short-term performance while ensuring we made the right decisions to deliver our long-term goals. We took decisive steps to further our ambition to be the world’s recognised leading Nutrition, Health and Wellness company, trusted by all stakeholders, while again delivering financial results in 2014 that outperformed the market.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes general economic conditions across emerging and developed markets and a company's strategic response, but contains no explicit causal relationships between actors operating at different spatial scales. The text presents broad market observations without identifying specific geographical actors or cross-scale influences.
gpt5: Rationale: The text describes global/economy-wide conditions in emerging and developed markets but provides no explicit causal links between different spatial scales. All effects are within broad transnational groupings, not cross-scale.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses global economic conditions and company strategy without explicit cross-scale interactions between defined spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes global economic conditions in 'many parts of the world,' 'emerging markets,' and 'developed markets,' which all fall under the Transnational scale. The company's response and ambition are also framed at a global, Transnational level. There are no explicit causal links or interactions between different spatial scales as defined (Local, Sub-national, National, Transnational).

Full Paragraph Text: Through continuous innovation and renovation of our food and beverages portfolio we are able to offer people healthier and tastier choices at every stage of their life, at any time of the day. Science-based innovation enables us to enhance the quality of people’s diets, using our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive contribution to society. Wherever you are in the world, we have safe, nutritious products to help you care for yourself and your family. A few years ago, we expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Health Science, motivated by the opportunity to forge a major therapeutic role for nutrition in the management of health. In line with this broadened strategy, in 2014 the Board approved the sale of 48.5 million L’Oréal shares to L’Oréal for cancellation. Part of the proceeds were used for the acquisition of the 50% stake in our joint venture Galderma from L’Oréal, bringing our ownership of Galderma to 100%. Galderma formed the foundation of a new Nestlé subsidiary, Nestlé Skin Health. Its goal is to be recognised as the leading company in skin health, offering science-based solutions to protect, nourish and enhance skin, and where needed to treat, correct and restore damaged skin over the course of people’s lives. Nestlé Skin Health provides prescription drugs, self-medication, therapeutic skin care and aesthetic and corrective medicine, allowing us to compete in the growing and promising multi-billion global skincare market. Nestlé Skin Health was further strengthened by the acquisition of the full rights to commercialise several key aesthetic dermatology products in the United States and Canada.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé's corporate strategy and business operations globally, but lacks explicit causal relationships between actors operating at different spatial scales. While it mentions global presence and specific regional acquisitions, these are descriptive statements about corporate activities rather than cross-scale interactions where one spatial level causally influences another.
gpt5: Links: National -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> National | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Mentions 'wherever you are in the world' and competing in the 'global skincare market'; National: Explicit actions tied to 'the United States and Canada' commercialization rights; Local / Site-specific: Effects on 'you and your family' imply household/individual sites
gpt5: Summary: [National, Transnational, Local] US/Canada commercialization rights strengthened a global unit; global reach provides products that help families locally.
gpt5: Rationale: National-market acquisitions explicitly strengthened a transnational subsidiary. The text also states global availability enabling household use; no sub-national scale is mentioned.
4o: Scale Explanations: National: The acquisition of rights to commercialise dermatology products in the United States and Canada is a national scale action.; Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé Skin Health's participation in the global skincare market and its operations across multiple countries represent a transnational scale.
4o: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] Nestlé Skin Health's global strategy impacts national markets by commercializing products in the US and Canada.
4o: Rationale: The text describes Nestlé Skin Health's global market strategy and its specific actions in national markets like the US and Canada. This illustrates a clear cross-scale interaction from transnational to national levels.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational: Nestlé and its subsidiaries (Nestlé Health Science, Nestlé Skin Health, Galderma) operate 'wherever you are in the world' and target the 'multi-billion global skincare market', indicating multi-country operations and global strategic decisions.; National: The 'United States and Canada' are explicitly mentioned as specific country-level markets where Nestlé Skin Health acquired commercialization rights.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational, National] Nestlé Skin Health, a transnational entity, acquired commercialization rights for products specifically within the United States and Canada.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details Nestlé Skin Health (Transnational) acquiring rights to commercialize products in the United States and Canada (National), demonstrating a clear causal link from a global corporate strategy to specific national markets. No other cross-scale interactions are explicitly stated, and no Local or Sub-national scales are mentioned.

Full Paragraph Text: These developments ensure that, building on the strong foundations of our food and beverages business and guided increasingly by science, we can further expand our portfolio to provide promising platforms for future growth in line with our strategy of Nutrition, Health and Wellness. At the same time, we continue the drive to ensure our company is organised efficiently and effectively to deliver continuous profitable growth over the long term. With this objective in mind we made some key decisions, adapting our organisational structure to better prepare ourselves today to meet the challenges of tomorrow.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses corporate strategy, organizational structure, and business portfolio expansion but contains no explicit geographical references or spatial scales. All mentioned activities (portfolio expansion, organizational changes, growth strategies) lack spatial specificity and do not indicate cross-scale geographical interactions.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal corporate strategy and restructuring without any geographic actors or scales. No explicit cross-scale causal links are stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses internal company strategies and organizational changes without mentioning any specific spatial scales or cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph focuses on a company's internal strategic decisions regarding portfolio expansion and organizational structure. It does not describe any specific actions or impacts that can be explicitly mapped to the provided spatial scales (Local, Sub-national, National, Transnational), nor does it describe any interactions between different geographical levels.

Full Paragraph Text: While our company continues to benefit from its decentralised structure, allowing key decisions to be made as close as possible to consumers, there is still an important opportunity to better leverage our scale. That is why in 2014 we set up Nestlé Business Excellence at Executive Board Level, combining GLOBE (Nestlé’s Global Business Excellence function) with Nestlé Business Services (our shared operation for transactional services around the world) and Nestlé Con tinuous Excellence (our continuous improvement and LEAN programme). Through a focus on three areas: Simplifying, Standardising and Sharing, Nestlé Business Excellence will allow us to decrease structural costs and operational expenses, freeing up resources to support growth. This will also allow our markets to keep a sharp focus on generating demand.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal corporate restructuring and business process optimization within Nestlé. While it mentions 'decentralised structure' and 'markets,' these refer to organizational divisions rather than distinct geographical scales with causal interactions between them.
gpt5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> National | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé Business Excellence, combining global functions and operations 'around the world', is a firm-wide cross-border actor.; National: 'Our markets' refers to country-level business units focusing on demand.; Local / Site-specific: Decisions made 'as close as possible to consumers' indicate site-specific/local decision-making.
gpt5: Summary: [Transnational, National, Local] Global Nestlé functions free resources and enable country markets to focus on demand, while decentralization pushes decisions down near consumers.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links global corporate structures to both national markets and local decision points. 'Markets' is interpreted as country units; no explicit sub-national regions are mentioned.
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Decisions made close to consumers imply local or site-specific actions.; Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé Business Excellence operates globally, affecting multiple countries.
4o: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Nestlé's global initiatives support local markets by optimizing resources.
4o: Rationale: The global Nestlé Business Excellence initiative impacts local markets by optimizing resources, demonstrating a clear cross-scale interaction. The focus is on how global strategies support local decision-making and demand generation.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé, Nestlé Business Excellence, GLOBE (Global Business Excellence function), and Nestlé Business Services (shared operation around the world) are explicitly described with global or multi-country scope.; National: 'Our markets' refers to the country-level or major regional operational units of the global company, responsible for generating demand within specific nations, distinct from the overarching transnational corporate functions.
gemini2.5: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border] A transnational corporate initiative (Nestlé Business Excellence) is set up to enable its national markets to focus on generating demand.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph details how Nestlé Business Excellence, a transnational corporate function, is established to streamline operations, which in turn 'will also allow our markets to keep a sharp focus on generating demand'. This clearly links actions at the transnational corporate level to their direct impact on the operational focus of national markets, thus demonstrating an explicit cross-scale interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: We have integrated the Maghreb, the Middle East, the North East Africa region, Turkey and Israel into Zone Europe to form Zone EMENA (Europe, Middle East and North Africa). This balances the different consumer dynamics and opportunities in each geography. Additionally it allows a sharper focus in Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa, a fast-growing part
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational restructuring of business zones by combining regions, but does not establish explicit causal relationships between actors at different spatial scales. It's a descriptive reorganization rather than cross-scale interaction.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: National: Turkey and Israel are individual countries.; Transnational / Cross-border: Zone Europe and the resulting Zone EMENA span multiple countries.
gpt5: Summary: [National, Transnational] Turkey and Israel are integrated into Zone Europe to create EMENA, linking national units to a transnational zone.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that Turkey and Israel (national) are integrated into Zone Europe to form EMENA (transnational). Other regions mentioned are also transnational, so no additional cross-scale links apply.
4o: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Zone EMENA and Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa involve multiple countries and regions.; Sub-national / Regional: The integration of specific regions like the Maghreb, Middle East, and North East Africa into Zone EMENA.

4o: Rationale: The integration of various regions into Zone EMENA is a transnational action affecting regional consumer dynamics. The text explicitly mentions the impact on regional opportunities, justifying the cross-scale link.

gemini2.5: Summary: [National, Transnational] National-level countries (Turkey, Israel) are integrated into the Transnational Zone Europe, forming a new Transnational Zone EMENA.

This action directly causes the expansion and restructuring of the Transnational entity, establishing a clear National to Transnational causal link. Other described integrations are between Transnational entities, and subsequent effects remain within the Transnational scale without explicit cross-scale implications.

Full Paragraph Text: The new Nestlé Business Excellence function is led by Chris Johnson, the former head of Zone Americas. Zone Americas is now led by Laurent Freixe, the former head of Zone Europe, and the new Zone EMENA by Luis Cantarell, who previously was in charge of Nestlé Nutrition and Nestlé Health Science. The new head of Nestlé Nutrition is Heiko Schipper, who was formerly responsible for our Global Infant Nutrition division. Nestlé Health Science is led by Greg Behar, who joined the company from Boehringer Ingelheim in July. The newly established Nestlé Skin Health is led by Humberto Antunes, former ly the Chief Executive Officer of our joint venture Galderma.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph describes internal corporate restructuring and leadership appointments within Nestlé's organizational divisions. While it mentions geographic zones (Americas, Europe, EMENA), these are corporate organizational units rather than spatial scales with causal interactions between different geographical levels of governance or action.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph lists leadership appointments within Nestlé without stating any causal effects across spatial scales. No explicit cross-scale interactions are described.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational changes within Nestlé without any explicit cross-scale spatial interactions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational changes and personnel movements within a company. While some entities mentioned (e.g., 'Zone Americas', 'Global Infant Nutrition division') represent explicit spatial scales (Transnational/Cross-border), all such explicitly defined spatial scopes fall under the same 'Transnational' category. There are no explicit causal links or interactions described between entities operating at different spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We further reinforced our business through continued active portfolio management, reviewing the performance of different products in different markets to assess strate gic fit, the extent to which they were accretive against our financial targets, and what investments were necessary to deliver growth. We made choices about where we wanted to invest, where we wanted to improve, and what we wanted to divest. Making such choices enables us to align our resourc es behind our best ideas, products and categories, to deliver sustained financial performance and help us on our journey to recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership over the short term and the long term.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph describes internal corporate portfolio management activities without identifying specific geographical locations or cross-scale spatial interactions. The mention of 'different markets' is too vague to establish concrete spatial scales or causal relationships between them.
gpt5: Rationale: The text mentions 'different markets' but provides no explicit spatial scales (local, regional, national, transnational) or cross-scale causal links. It describes internal corporate portfolio choices without spatial actors.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses internal business strategies without explicit cross-scale interactions or actors that can be mapped to specific spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a business's internal portfolio management and strategic decision-making process. While it mentions operating in 'different markets,' this phrase is too general to identify distinct spatial scales interacting causally. There are no explicit causal links between specific spatial scales (e.g., local impacting national, or transnational influencing sub-national) described in the text.

Full Paragraph Text: We also announced new investments and research collaborations, which will enhance our ability to deliver sci ence-based solutions to improve the quality of people’s lives. A newly-announced research partnership with the EpiGen consortium will help us to better develop our understanding of the influence of nutrition and genetics at the beginning of life and continue to build our knowledge in this important area. The Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences began a collab oration on a groundbreaking project, which could one day lead to the development of made-to-measure vitamin com binations tailored to individual needs. Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Today we continue to invest in science-based innovation to ensure we can answer current and future needs.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes corporate research partnerships and innovation activities but does not specify any geographical locations or spatial scales for these activities. Without explicit spatial context, no cross-scale interactions can be identified.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph mentions corporate R&D collaborations and individual-level outcomes but no explicit geographic or jurisdictional scales. Without stated local, regional, national, or transnational contexts, no cross-scale causal links can be drawn.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes collaborations and investments without explicit cross-scale interactions. No specific spatial scales or causal links between different scales are mentioned.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: The 'company' (Nestlé) and its 'Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences' are multinational entities undertaking 'new investments and research collaborations' and a 'groundbreaking project' with global applicability and scope.; Local / Site-specific: The 'quality of people’s lives' and 'individual needs' refer to specific, individual-level impacts or needs, fitting the definition of specific places or individuals.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] A global company's investments and projects are designed to improve the quality of people's lives and cater to individual needs.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how the multinational company's (Transnational) investments and research lead to solutions impacting individual people's lives and needs (Local). The causal link is clear from the text stating solutions 'to improve the quality of people’s lives' and 'tailored to individual needs'.

Full Paragraph Text: It is our fundamental belief that to be successful over time we need to create value for our shareholders while at the same time creating value for society. We call this Creating Shared Value. To prosper we have to take a long-term view, framed in a robust set of principles and values that are based on respect: respect for people, respect for the environment, and respect for the world we live in. What we do and the effects of what we do are highly visible. It is our responsibility to connect with different stakeholders, to show transparency and build trust. We have therefore again in 2014 reported on our social performance and our compliance in our Nestlé in society report, and our progress towards meeting the tough targets we set ourselves.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph presents corporate philosophy and values without specifying any geographical actors or spatial scales. While it mentions 'society' and 'the world,' these are abstract concepts rather than concrete spatial entities with causal relationships.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph uses generic, company-wide language without naming specific spatial scales or causal interactions between them. No explicit cross-scale link is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses general principles and values without specifying concrete actors or actions at different spatial scales, thus no cross-scale interactions are identified.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a transnational company's internal philosophy, values, and reporting mechanisms. It uses broad terms like 'society' and 'the world we live in,' which do not map to the specific spatial scales provided (Local, Sub-national, National, Transnational) as distinct interacting entities. There are no explicit causal links between the company's actions (Transnational scale) and any other defined spatial scale.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we held another successful Creating Shared Value forum, this time at the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne, co-organised for the first time with a United Nations body, the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD). The President of the Swiss Confederation used his address to the event to plead for water to become a self-standing goal of the future global development agenda. At the event we renewed our long-standing partnership with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies. Since 2006 this collaboration has focused on the improvement of rural communities’ access to clean water and sanitation.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Rural communities receiving water and sanitation improvements; National: Swiss Confederation President advocating for water policy; Transnational / Cross-border: UN body (UNCTAD) and global development agenda being influenced
claude4: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border] Swiss President advocates for water as global development goal at UN event
claude4: Rationale: The Swiss President (national actor) explicitly advocated to influence the global development agenda (transnational). The rural communities partnership represents local impact but lacks explicit cross-scale causation in the text.
gpt5: Links: National -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Event at the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne; focus on rural communities’ water/sanitation access.; National: President of the Swiss Confederation (country-level actor).; Transnational / Cross-border: UNCTAD and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies are global bodies; references to the future global development agenda.
gpt5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National, Transnational / Cross-border] A national plea aimed to shape the global agenda; a transnational partnership targets local rural water and sanitation access.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit links show a national actor trying to influence a global agenda and a transnational collaboration acting on local water access. Other event details are contextual and not clear causal cross-scale links.
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: The Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne is a specific location where the forum was held.; Transnational / Cross-border: The involvement of the UNCTAD and the global development agenda indicates a transnational scale.
4o: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, Transnational / Cross-border] The forum at Nestlé's center in Lausanne linked local actions to global development goals through UNCTAD's involvement.
4o: Rationale: The forum at a local site involved a transnational body (UNCTAD), creating a clear cross-scale interaction. The focus on water as a global goal further supports this link.
gemini2.5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific | National -> Local / Site-specific | Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Final Link: National -> Local / Site-specific, Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Refers to specific places like the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne, 'the event' held there, and 'rural communities'.; National: Refers to the 'President of the Swiss Confederation' representing a country-level entity.; Transnational / Cross-border: Refers to multi-country initiatives or bodies such as the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), the 'global development agenda', and the 'International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National, Transnational / Cross-border] scales interact through a national leader engaging with a local event that becomes a platform for a transnational plea, alongside other transnational influences on local communities.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how a National actor engaged with a Local event, which then served as a platform to influence a Transnational agenda. Additionally, Transnational entities like UNCTAD co-organised the local event, and a Transnational collaboration directly impacted local communities.

Full Paragraph Text: Currently, at the United Nations there are intense discussions about the global development goals for the period after 2015. At the same time, governments and international organ isations are increasingly reliant on the expertise, experience and resources of the private sector to help address some of the world’s most pressing problems. This offers an opportunity for global companies such as Nestlé to make a valu able contribution, in partnership with governments and civil society. We are participating actively in the policy dialogue in areas which will deeply influence our future business, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability, and human rights.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: United Nations discussions about global development goals and international organisations represent multi-country/planetary level governance; National: Governments mentioned as partners with private sector represent country-level actors
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] UN global development goals influence national governments' partnerships with private sector
claude4: Rationale: The UN's global development goal discussions create frameworks that national governments then implement through partnerships. The text shows transnational policy dialogue shaping national-level government actions in partnering with companies like Nestlé.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: National: “Governments” refers to country-level actors.; Transnational: “Global companies such as Nestlé” operate across countries; UN is also transnational.
gpt5: Summary: [National, Transnational] Governments’ reliance on private-sector expertise creates opportunities for global companies to contribute.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties government reliance on private-sector expertise to opportunities for global companies to contribute. Other mentions (UN, international organisations) don’t form clear cross-scale causal links beyond same-scale.
4o: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: The United Nations discussions and global companies like Nestlé are involved in global development goals.; National: Governments are mentioned as partners in addressing global problems.
4o: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] Global companies and international organizations collaborate with national governments to tackle global challenges.
4o: Rationale: The text describes a collaboration between global entities and national governments, indicating a cross-scale interaction. The scales are limited to transnational and national due to the explicit mention of global companies and governments.
gemini2.5: Links: National -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> National
gemini2.5: Final Link: National -> Transnational / Cross-border, Transnational / Cross-border -> National
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: National: The term 'governments' refers to country-level entities, even when participating in global discussions, as distinguished from 'international organisations'.; Transnational / Cross-border: References to 'United Nations', 'global development goals', 'international organisations', 'world’s most pressing problems', and 'global companies such as Nestlé' explicitly indicate a multi-country or planetary scale.
gemini2.5: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border] National governments rely on transnational private sector, and transnational global companies contribute to national governments.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The primary cross-scale interactions involve national governments and transnational actors like global companies. National governments are explicitly reliant on the transnational private sector, which in turn contributes to these national entities, establishing a two-way interaction between the National and Transnational scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Our success has always been based upon our determination to stay the course and look ahead, to understand the environment in which we operate, to organise ourselves to seize opportunities to deliver profitable growth, now and in the future. Although we are operating in a challenging and turbulent economic environment, we see these as fascinating times, full of opportunities. We continue to commit ourselves to ambitious financial targets. We aim to achieve organic growth of around 5% to 6%, improvements in margins and underlying earnings per share in constant currencies, as well as capital efficiency. There will be years when we exceed our ambition and years where we come close, but this is the line we want to walk over time.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph discusses corporate strategy and financial targets without identifying specific actors at different spatial scales or explicit causal relationships between geographical levels. The content is generic business discourse lacking spatial specificity.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph mentions corporate strategy and financial targets without naming locations, jurisdictions, or cross-scale causes. No explicit spatial actors or causal links are present to map.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses internal business strategies and goals without mentioning any specific spatial scales or cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph focuses on an organization's internal financial objectives and its perception of a generic 'economic environment'. There are no explicit mentions of specific geographic locations, political entities (like cities, states, or countries), or cross-border issues that would allow for mapping to the defined spatial scales or identifying cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: We would like to thank our 339000 employees, whose com mitment to Nestlé, hard work and disciplined alignment behind our strategy ensured that we achieved our common goals. Their talent, their creativity, their discipline and entrepreneurship are key to delivering our results. We would also like to thank you, our shareholders, for your investment and your confidence, which have enabled us to deliver good returns for investors over the long term.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph contains only corporate acknowledgments to employees and shareholders without any geographical references or spatial scale distinctions. No actors are mapped to specific spatial scales, and there are no cross-scale causal interactions described.
gpt5: Rationale: The passage thanks employees and shareholders without referencing any geographic scales or policies. No explicit cross-scale causal interactions are stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not describe any explicit spatial cross-scale interactions. It focuses on internal company dynamics and shareholder relations without linking different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal corporate achievements and investor relations without any explicit mention of different spatial scales or interactions between them. All actors (employees, Nestlé, shareholders) are presented as operating at a single, undifferentiated corporate/global level, lacking specific geographical context to identify cross-scale links.

Full Paragraph Text: For almost 150 years we have enhanced people’s lives by offer ing tastier and healthier food and beverages choices at all stages of life and at any time of day, helping them care for themselves and their families. We have built our success by anticipating the future and continuously adapting ourselves to seize the opportunities it presents.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph contains only generic corporate messaging about food and beverage offerings without any specific geographical actors, locations, or cross-scale interactions. No spatial scales or causal relationships between different geographical levels are mentioned.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph contains no explicit spatial references (local, regional, national, or transnational) or cross-scale causal links. It is a generic corporate statement without identifiable scale-based actors or actions.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not mention any specific actors or actions that can be mapped to distinct spatial scales, nor does it describe any explicit cross-scale interactions.

It does not mention any specific geographical locations or actions that operate at different spatial scales, nor does it describe any causal links or interactions between them. Full Paragraph Text: Our ambition is not just to be the leader but the industry refer ence for Nutrition, Health and Wellness. In recent years we have built on the strong foundations of our unrivalled food and bev erage portfolio, exploring the benefits of nutrition’s therapeutic role with Nestlé Health Science. In 2014 we again expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Skin Health, offering scientifically-proven products and solutions for people’s skin health needs throughout their lives.

Full Paragraph Text: Nutrition, Health and Wellness is a priority for the people who buy our products, for society as a whole and for us as a busi ness. As the world’s leading food and beverage company we have a responsibility to use our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive difference to society. We have an important role to play in not only provid ing good nutrition but in helping people understand its value.

Full Paragraph Text: Start Healthy Stay Healthy is our interactive, science-based education programme designed to help parents and care givers provide nutritionally and developmentally adequate nutrition in the crucial first 1000 days of life. We support and promote breastfeeding as the best start a baby can have in life. Our educational programmes are targeted at people who are most involved in implementing good practices during this important early period in a child’s development. We help to guide parents and caregivers to raise healthier children and help healthcare professionals have a greater impact on the nutritional aspects of care of future generations.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a general education program without specifying any geographical locations, jurisdictions, or spatial scales. No cross-scale interactions are mentioned or implied.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit geographic scales (local, regional, national, transnational) are mentioned, nor any cross-scale causal links. The text describes a program’s aims toward parents and healthcare professionals without spatial context.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a program focused on individual and local-level education without explicit cross-scale interactions.

All identified actors and their actions (the program, parents/caregivers, healthcare professionals, and children) operate at a direct, individual, or community level, which falls under the Local / Site-specific scale. No explicit interactions involving broader spatial scales (Sub-national, National, or Transnational) are mentioned or implied.

Full Paragraph Text: We continue to reinforce our leadership in the area of chil dren’s nutrition. By the end of 2014 98% of all our products for children met the Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria for children. These criteria are based on nutrition science and public health dietary recommendations from bodies such as the World Health Organization and the Institute of Medicine. Our products are evaluated against these criteria using the Nestlé Nutritional Profiling System which determines their nutritional value and whether they achieve Nestlé Nutritional Foundation status.
claude4: Scale Explanations: National: Nestlé as a multinational corporation operating across individual countries with country-specific product portfolios; Transnational / Cross-border: World Health Organization and Institute of Medicine providing global/international dietary recommendations and nutrition science standards
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] International health organizations' dietary standards guide corporate nutrition criteria for children's products.
claude4: Rationale: The WHO and Institute of Medicine provide transnational nutrition science and dietary recommendations that Nestlé explicitly uses to establish their corporate nutritional criteria. This creates a clear influence from international health bodies to national/corporate-level product standards.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: National: The Institute of Medicine is a U.S. national body issuing dietary recommendations.; Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé is a multinational; its Nutritional Foundation criteria apply across countries.
gpt5: Summary: [National, Transnational] U.S. Institute of Medicine recommendations underpin Nestlé’s global nutritional criteria.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the criteria are based on the Institute of Medicine’s recommendations, creating a national-to-transnational influence. WHO is also cited but is transnational-to-transnational, so excluded.
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Nestlé's products for children are distributed and consumed in specific local markets.; Transnational / Cross-border: The World Health Organization and the Institute of Medicine provide international dietary recommendations.
4o: Summary: [Transnational, Local] International dietary guidelines shape local product nutrition standards.
4o: Rationale: The link is established by the influence of international bodies on local product standards. The scales are limited to local and transnational due to the explicit mention of international guidelines affecting local product criteria.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: National: The Institute of Medicine is a US-based organization, representing a country-level body for health recommendations.; Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé is a multinational company setting global criteria for its products, and the World Health Organization is an international body.
gemini2.5: Summary: [National, Transnational / Cross-border] Nestlé's transnational product criteria are explicitly based on recommendations from a national-level institute.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The link identifies how recommendations from a national body, the Institute of Medicine, influence the global standards set by a transnational corporation, Nestlé. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were found, as most actions either occurred within the transnational scale or lacked clear causality between different scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We are carrying out large-scale studies together with lead ing scientists of children’s diet and lifestyles, based on the success of the Nestlé Feeding Infants and Toddlers Study. In addition to dietary intakes and behaviours, our research explores family dynamics around diets and key lifestyle patterns of children while documenting their height and weight. We use this data to support our product reformulation, consumer communication and educational programmes, and we share the results with the wider scientific community, non-governmental organisations and others.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes research activities and data sharing but does not specify any geographical scales or locations. While it mentions 'large-scale studies' and sharing with various organizations, there are no explicit spatial references or cross-scale causal relationships between geographically distinct actors.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit geographic scales or cross-scale causal links are stated. Actions (research, reformulation, sharing with scientific community/NGOs) lack clear spatial scale assignments.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes research activities and data sharing but lacks explicit cross-scale causal interactions between different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Final Link: Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border, Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Refers to 'children’s diet and lifestyles,' 'family dynamics around diets,' and 'height and weight,' which are specific, individual-level observations and behaviors.; Transnational / Cross-border: Refers to 'we' (Nestlé, a global company), 'leading scientists' (implying international collaboration), 'large-scale studies,' and sharing results with the 'wider scientific community, non-governmental organisations and others,' indicating a multi-country or global scope for the research and its outputs like 'product reformulation, consumer communication and educational programmes.'

Conversely, the transnational 'consumer communication and educational programmes' are explicitly designed to affect behaviors and dynamics at the local, site-specific level. Only two scales, Local and Transnational, are explicitly involved in causal cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: We ensure global compliance with responsible advertising and marketing standards for children, abiding by external pledges such as the EU Pledge. At the end of 2014, the Ex ecutive Board approved an updated and strengthened Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy, which will come into effect in December 2015. To ensure consistent and effective implementation, detailed internal guidelines have been developed and external stakeholders are encouraged to provide feedback via our Tell us reporting mechanism. We have phased out our marketing communication in schools and reinforced our health and wellness education activities, particularly those that positively impact children’s development and support governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: EU Pledge represents cross-border regulatory framework and global compliance standards; Local / Site-specific: Marketing communication in schools and health education activities in specific educational facilities
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Global advertising standards drive local changes in school marketing practices
claude4: Rationale: The EU Pledge and global compliance standards explicitly cause Nestlé to phase out marketing in schools and modify local educational activities. This represents clear transnational influence on site-specific implementation.
gpt5: Rationale: Mentions transnational (EU Pledge), local (schools), and governments’ goals, but no explicit causal link across different scales is stated. Actions are corporate/internal or not tied to a second, distinct scale.
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Marketing communication in schools and health education activities are specific to local sites.; Transnational / Cross-border: The EU Pledge is a multi-country initiative affecting advertising standards across borders.
4o: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] The EU Pledge impacts local marketing practices in schools, showing a cross-scale interaction.
4o: Rationale: The EU Pledge, a transnational initiative, directly influences local marketing practices in schools, demonstrating a clear cross-scale interaction. The scales are limited to transnational and local due to the specific nature of the actions described.

gemini2.5: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific, Local / Site-specific -> National
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé operates globally, ensuring 'global compliance', abiding by 'EU Pledge' (a multi-country initiative), and approving a company-wide 'Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy' affecting all its operations.; Local / Site-specific: Marketing communication is phased out in 'schools' (specific places), and 'health and wellness education activities' are reinforced, which are implemented at specific sites or communities.; National: The education activities explicitly 'support governments’ goals', referring to country-level entities and policies.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational, Local, National] Nestlé's transnational policies are implemented locally through school marketing changes and education activities, which in turn support national government goals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Nestlé's transnational policies lead to implementations at the local/site-specific level, such as phasing out school marketing and reinforcing education activities. These local activities are then explicitly stated to support national governments' goals, illustrating a direct cross-scale interaction across three distinct levels.

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014 the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme was in 73 countries, supporting initiatives which demonstrate how appropriate nutrition and exercise can improve the health of children and their communities. In addition, our own studies in four countries have shown that two thirds of children are insufficiently hydrated when they arrive at school. In 2014 we provided tools and information that schools, parents and caregivers need to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé programme operating across 73 countries represents multi-country initiative; Local / Site-specific: Schools where children arrive and where tools/information are provided represent specific local facilities
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Nestlé's global programme delivers nutrition tools to local schools and communities.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows Nestlé's multinational programme explicitly providing tools and information to local schools and caregivers. The cross-scale interaction is direct and causal, with the global initiative supporting local health education efforts.

gpt5: Summary: [Transnational, Local] A multi-country Nestlé program provides support and tools to schools and communities to improve child health.
gpt5: Rationale: Explicit text shows a global program delivering resources that act at school/community level. No clear national-scale causal step is stated, so only transnational-to-local is retained.
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Schools are specific places where the hydration tools and information are implemented.; Transnational / Cross-border: The Nestlé Healthy Kids programme operates in 73 countries, indicating a cross-border scale.

4o: Rationale: The Nestlé Healthy Kids programme operates across multiple countries, providing resources to local schools. This creates a clear cross-scale interaction from a transnational initiative to local implementation.

'We' (Nestlé) providing tools implies the same organizational scale.; Local / Site-specific: The 'initiatives' benefiting 'communities', children's hydration 'at school', and the provision of tools to 'schools, parents and caregivers' all refer to specific places, institutions, or immediate social contexts within local areas.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] Nestlé's transnational Healthy Kids programme and corporate actions directly support initiatives, provide tools, and disseminate information to local communities and schools, demonstrating a clear downward influence.
gemini2.5: Rationale: Explicit links show Nestlé's transnational programme supporting local initiatives and the company providing resources directly to local schools and communities. Only two distinct scales were detectable, as the text focuses on Nestlé's multi-country operations and their direct engagement with specific local contexts within those countries, without mentioning sub-national or national policies as intermediaries.

Full Paragraph Text: United for Healthier Kids is a platform, created by Nestlé in 2014, where society can engage and collaborate to find ways to improve the health and wellness of children, from conception to the age of 12 years. In Mexico, a TV series was launched which supports and encourages five families looking to change their eating and lifestyle habits over six months. The platform has also been launched in the Philippines.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé's United for Healthier Kids platform operates across multiple countries as a global corporate initiative; National: Platform implementation in specific countries - Mexico with TV series and Philippines launch
claude4: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, National] Global corporate health platform implemented in specific countries with localized programs
claude4: Rationale: Nestlé's transnational platform directly influences national-level implementations in Mexico and Philippines. The link is explicit as the global platform 'was launched' and 'has been launched' in these specific countries with adapted content.

gpt5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: The 'United for Healthier Kids' platform spans multiple countries.; National: Country-level actions: launch in the Philippines; TV series in Mexico.; Local / Site-specific: Specific households: five families in Mexico.
gpt5: Summary: [Transnational; National; Local] A global child-health platform rolls out in the Philippines, while a Mexico TV series aids five specific families.
gpt5: Rationale: One cross-scale link is the global platform’s launch in the Philippines (transnational to national). Another is Mexico’s TV series aiding five families (national to local); no explicit global-to-Mexico link stated.
4o: Scale Explanations: National: The platform was launched in entire countries like Mexico and the Philippines.; Local / Site-specific: The TV series in Mexico targets specific families, indicating a local implementation.
4o: Summary: [National, Local / Site-specific] The national launch of the platform in Mexico led to a local TV series targeting specific families to change habits.
4o: Rationale: The national scale is evident from the platform's launch in entire countries. The local scale is shown by the TV series targeting specific families in Mexico. The link is clear from the national initiative leading to local actions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational: Nestlé, as a multinational company, and its 'United for Healthier Kids' platform, which is launched across multiple countries, represent a transnational scale.; National: Mexico and the Philippines, as specific countries where the platform or initiatives are launched, operate at the national scale.; Local / Site-specific: The 'five families' in Mexico, as specific targets of a national program, constitute a local/site-specific intervention point.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational, National, Local / Site-specific] A transnational platform initiates national-level programs which then impact local-level families.

In Mexico, this national initiative further extends its influence by directly supporting local families, demonstrating explicit cross-scale interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Through innovation and renovation we continue to make our products tastier and healthier. In line with the recommendations from public health authorities, we are reducing the amount of salt, sugar and saturated fats in our products as part of our contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society. Our reduction targets are in cluded in our public nutrition commitments (detailed in the Nestlé in society report) so our progress can be measured. We are also ensuring that whole grains are the primary ingredient in our breakfast cereals for children and teenagers.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes corporate product reformulation activities and nutrition commitments but does not specify any spatial scales or geographical locations. While 'public health authorities' and 'society' are mentioned, no explicit cross-scale causal relationships between different geographical levels are established.
gpt5: Rationale: Actors and actions are present, but 'public health authorities' and the company’s operational scale are not explicitly mapped to a specific spatial scale. Without clear scales, no cross-scale causal link can be established.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses product changes and public health recommendations but lacks explicit cross-scale interactions between different spatial scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: National: The 'public health authorities' are interpreted as country-level bodies providing recommendations, and the 'fight against non-communicable diseases in society' refers to national public health efforts and impacts within countries.; Transnational:  'we' refers to Nestlé, a global corporation whose 'public nutrition commitments' and product changes apply across multiple countries.
gemini2.5: Summary: [National, Transnational] National public health recommendations influence Nestlé's transnational product changes, which in turn contribute to national efforts against non-communicable diseases.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes Nestlé, a transnational corporation, modifying its products based on 'recommendations from public health authorities,' interpreted as national bodies, creating a National to Transnational influence. These changes are explicitly stated as a 'contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society,' interpreted as impacting national public health outcomes, thus establishing a Transnational to National influence.

Full Paragraph Text: We want to help people who buy our products to make informed decisions by giving them better nutritional information on our product labels. We are enhancing our portion guidance and have committed to print GDAs (Guideline Daily Amounts) on the front of all relevant packaging. These make it easier for people to see how much salt, sugar or fat is in the product, and how the amounts compare to reference daily guidelines. Nestlé Portion Guidance is a voluntary initiative
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph describes Nestlé's corporate product labeling initiative but contains no explicit geographical references or spatial scales. The actions described (enhancing portion guidance, printing GDAs on packaging) are corporate policy decisions without clear spatial attribution or cross-scale causal relationships between different geographical levels.
gpt5: Rationale: The text describes a company’s voluntary labeling initiative without naming any geographic jurisdictions or multi-level governance. No explicit cross-scale (local, regional, national, transnational) causal links are stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a company initiative without explicit cross-scale interactions. It focuses on product labeling, which does not map to distinct spatial scales as defined.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: Nestlé, as a global company, implements 'Nestlé Portion Guidance' as a 'voluntary initiative' applying to 'all relevant packaging,' which implies a multi-country, company-wide policy rather than a country-specific one.; Local / Site-specific: Product labels and packaging are physical items directly encountered by consumers at a specific place, like a store or home, fitting the definition of a specific site.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] A global company's initiative dictates the nutritional information displayed on individual product packaging, impacting local consumer interaction.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The explicit cross-scale interaction shows Nestlé's (Transnational) company-wide policy to print GDAs directly influencing the content on product packaging (Local). This demonstrates a global corporate decision leading to a specific, local-level modification of products. Only two scales were identified as having explicit causal links, limiting the complexity of interactions to a single path.

Full Paragraph Text: that bridges the gap between dietary recommendations and more user-friendly information to promote the right portion size. It is designed to help reframe portion norms, particularly in energy dense categories where habitual servings have increased over time.

Therefore, no explicit spatial scales or cross-scale interactions can be identified from the text.

Full Paragraph Text: In parts of the world where people find it difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals in their daily diets, we fortify foods to help them and their families stay healthy. We are on track to deliver our commitment of 200 billion servings of micronutrient fortified foods and beverages annually around the world by next year. In 2014 we continued to extend the reach of our microfortification programmes, focusing on categories for children and women of child-bearing age, such as fortified infant cereals and growing-up milks.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a global corporate initiative to deliver fortified foods worldwide, but lacks explicit causal relationships between different spatial scales. While the text mentions 'parts of the world' and 'around the world,' it does not specify how actions at one geographical scale causally influence or are influenced by actions at another distinct spatial scale.
gpt5: Rationale: The passage describes a global corporate effort (“around the world”) without naming specific local, regional, or national actors or actions. No explicit causal links across different spatial scales are stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a global initiative to fortify foods but does not explicitly link actions or actors across different spatial scales. The focus is on a general global effort without specific cross-scale interactions.

Daily diets and individual/family health benefits are specific to local households.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific] A transnational entity provides globally fortified foods, directly impacting the health of local individuals and families.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a 'We' (transnational actor) operating microfortification programmes 'around the world' to deliver fortified foods. These efforts directly benefit 'people and their families' by improving their 'daily diets' and helping them 'stay healthy', which are local-level impacts. This establishes a clear causal link from a transnational action to local outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: The Nespresso AAA Sustainable Quality Programme, developed with the Rainforest Alliance, was launched in 2003. Full Paragraph Text: At our 2014 CSV Forum, we announced that we will transform our European Youth Employment Initiative into a global programme. Full Paragraph Text: For the Nestlé Needs YOUth programme in Europe, where one in four people under the age of 25 is unemployed, we pledged to offer 20000 jobs, apprenticeships and traineeships over three years, and establish readiness for work activities across our operations. Full Paragraph Text: We built on the success of this initiative in 2014 by establishing the Alliance for YOUth, a collaboration with around 200 other companies, to scale up and coordinate our efforts to tackle youth unemployment. Full Paragraph Text: The new technology used at the factory in Jalisco, Mexico, heats milk at low pressure to remove some of the water. The resulting steam is then condensed and treated and used to clean machines. It is then recycled and used again. The process reduces by 15% the total amount of water used by Nestlé Mexico. Work is now underway to deploy similar tech nology in five other manufacturing sites in water stressed are as around the world. It is just one of a number of water-saving initiatives we have introduced in recent years, allowing us to reduce total water withdrawal in absolute terms by almost one third in the last decade.
claude4: Links: Local / Site-specific -> National | Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border
claude4: Final Link: Local / Site-specific -> National, Local / Site-specific -> Transnational / Cross-border
claude4: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Factory in Jalisco, Mexico and five other manufacturing sites in water stressed areas; National: Nestlé Mexico operations with 15% water reduction; Transnational / Cross-border: Global deployment across multiple countries and worldwide water-saving initiatives
claude4: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National, Transnational / Cross-border] Factory technology in Jalisco impacts national operations and enables global deployment
claude4: Rationale: The Jalisco factory's water-saving technology directly reduces Nestlé Mexico's national water consumption and serves as the basis for global expansion to other sites. Both links show explicit causal influence from local innovation to broader scales.
gpt5: Links: Local / Site-specific -> National | Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Specific factory in Jalisco using new water-saving technology; National: Nestlé Mexico’s total water use metric; Transnational / Cross-border: Company actions spanning multiple countries ('around the world')
gpt5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific; National; Transnational / Cross-border] Jalisco factory tech cuts Nestlé Mexico water use 15%, and the company is rolling it out to other plants worldwide.
gpt5: Rationale: Text explicitly links a site’s process to a national reduction (15%). It also explicitly states global deployment to additional local sites; no other clear cross-scale causal links are stated.
4o: Links: Local / Site-specific -> National | National -> Transnational / Cross-border
4o: Final Link: Local / Site-specific -> National, National -> Transnational / Cross-border
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: The factory in Jalisco, Mexico, is a specific site where the technology is implemented.; National: Nestlé Mexico represents a national scale as it encompasses operations across the country.; Transnational / Cross-border: The deployment of technology in water-stressed areas around the world indicates a transnational scale.
4o: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National, Transnational / Cross-border] The Jalisco factory's technology reduces Nestlé Mexico's water use, influencing global deployment in water-stressed areas.
4o: Rationale: The Jalisco factory's local technology impacts Nestlé Mexico's national water usage, which is part of a global strategy to reduce water withdrawal. The scales are distinct and traceable through explicit actions and impacts mentioned in the text.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Local: The 'factory in Jalisco, Mexico' and 'five other manufacturing sites' refer to specific facilities or places.; National: 'Nestlé Mexico' refers to the company's operations within the country of Mexico.; Transnational: 'around the world' describes a multi-country or global deployment strategy and aggregated impact.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Local, National, Transnational] A local factory's new water-saving technology directly reduces water use for Nestlé Mexico and also serves as a model for a transnational deployment strategy to other local manufacturing sites globally.

This transnational strategy then targets other specific local manufacturing sites, demonstrating a direct influence across scales.

Full Paragraph Text: In March 2014, we opened the Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing, China. The new centre has three objectives: to collaborate with Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities in food safety research; to increase our ability to assess risks, anticipate problems and provide accurate information in any food safety situations; and to engage on scientific communication and food safety training.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing - a specific facility in a particular city; National: Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities - country-level academic and governmental institutions
claude4: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National] Beijing facility collaborates with Chinese national institutions on food safety research and training.
claude4: Rationale: The Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing (local facility) explicitly collaborates with Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities (national-level institutions). This represents a clear cross-scale interaction from local to national level.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: The Nestlé Food Safety Institute is located in Beijing, a specific city.; National: The text references 'Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities,' implying country-level institutions.
gpt5: Summary: [Local, National] The Beijing institute collaborates with Chinese national institutions and regulators on food safety research.
gpt5: Rationale: The local center explicitly collaborates with national-level Chinese institutions and authorities, creating a cross-scale interaction. No other explicit cross-scale causality is stated.
4o: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: The Nestlé Food Safety Institute is a specific facility located in Beijing, China.; Sub-national / Regional: The collaboration involves Chinese universities, research institutes, and regulatory authorities, which operate at a regional level within China.
4o: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, Sub-national / Regional] The Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing collaborates with regional universities and authorities on food safety research.
4o: Rationale: The link is established through the explicit mention of collaboration between a local facility and regional entities. The scales are limited to local and regional as the actions are confined within China.
gemini2.5: Links: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific | Local / Site-specific -> National
gemini2.5: Final Link: Transnational / Cross-border -> Local / Site-specific, Local / Site-specific -> National
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Transnational / Cross-border: 'we' (Nestlé) refers to a multinational corporation, which operates across multiple countries.; Local / Site-specific: The 'Nestlé Food Safety Institute in Beijing, China' is a specific facility located in a particular city.; National: 'Chinese universities, research institutes and regulatory authorities' represent institutions operating at the country level within China.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Transnational / Cross-border, Local / Site-specific, National] A transnational corporation opened a local institute, which then interacts with national Chinese organizations.

This local institute then has the explicit objective to collaborate with Chinese national universities, research institutes, and regulatory authorities (National).

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé is deeply integrated into people’s lives with many buying our products on a daily basis. This gives us opportunities to contribute meaningfully to their quality of life. It is what our promise of Good Food, Good Life is all about: offering the best tasting, healthiest choices across a wide range of food and beverages, from morning to night and throughout life, helping people to live more enjoyable, healthy lives.

Full Paragraph Text: However, today, even brands that enjoy a high level of loyalty and trust need attention grabbing, engaging consumer communication to ensure they remain relevant to consumers. Therefore, excellence in brand building discipline and conviction about the importance of strong, sustainable brand equity is more important than ever, especially in an increasingly complex and crowded digital world.

Full Paragraph Text: The successful roll-out of Maggi Oats Noodles demonstrated that healthy eating can be both enjoyable and tasty. Strong sales of the new product show that it is also good business. Maggi Oats Noodles meet Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria, which are based on public health recommendations. The consumer communication reinforces the importance for families to start the day with a well-balanced breakfast, including fruits and milk. In 2014, we continued to renovate Maggi products all around the world, reducing salt and fat and improving their nutritional benefits.

While 'all around the world' suggests global reach, no specific scales or causal relationships between different geographical levels are identified.

Full Paragraph Text: The Maggi company began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885. Julius Maggi had pioneered the production of pea and bean soups at the request of the Swiss Public Welfare Society to address the dietary deficiency of the work ing population. The advent of factory work for women meant less time to prepare food, and the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes historical events within Switzerland involving local actors (Maggi company, Swiss Public Welfare Society) and social changes (factory work for women), but does not establish any explicit causal relationships between different spatial scales. All mentioned actors and activities operate within the same national context without cross-scale interactions.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes historical events and motivations without explicit cross-scale interactions. The actions are localized to Switzerland without broader scale implications.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Local / Site-specific: The 'factory work for women' and its consequence of 'less time to prepare food' refer to specific facilities (factories) and individual household activities/constraints, fitting the definition of specific places/sites.; National: The 'Maggi company' selling 'in Switzerland', 'Julius Maggi' operating within Switzerland, the 'Swiss Public Welfare Society', and the 'dietary deficiency of the working population' (as a national social issue) all refer to country-level actions and concerns.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Local / Site-specific, National] The impact of local factory work and its effect on women's time led to a national social welfare request for a dietary solution.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text explicitly links local factory work, affecting food preparation, to a national dietary deficiency and welfare response. This establishes a direct causal interaction from Local / Site-specific to National; no other explicit cross-scale links are present.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo celebrated its 80th birthday in 2014. It was created by Nestlé engineer Thomas Mayne to help children who had poor diets get sufficient nutrition. Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s trading operating profit was CHF 14.0 billion, representing a margin of 15.3%, up 10 basis points, and up 30 basis points in constant currencies. Distribution costs were up by 10 basis points. Total marketing and administration expenses rose by 10 basis points as we increased consumer facing marketing support for our brands.

Full Paragraph Text: Our performance in North America was affected by the frozen category. Projects are underway to reposition Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets and Stouffers. They address all elements of the marketing mix, reflecting trends such as organic and ethnic, enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers. We are taking the same approach in frozen pizza where our California Pizza Kitchen did well. In ice cream the super premium segment performed well with Gelato, and snacks returned to growth, although the premium segment was subdued. In confectionery the successful roll-out of Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups continued. Innovations like Natural Bliss and seasonal renovations of flavours helped Coffee-mate de liver good growth. Innovation also ensured the petcare busi ness in North America continued to grow with Dog Chow, Pro Plan and Tidy Cats Lightweight cat litter as highlights. The launch of Beyond natural pet food gained momentum.

Full Paragraph Text: Latin America delivered good organic growth despite a worsening of the macroeconomic situation towards the end of the year. Although consumer sentiment varied across the region, most markets did well. All Brazil’s categories grew, with Ninho in growing-up milks, KitKat in confectionery, Nesfit in biscuits and Nescau in cocoa and malt beverages making strong contributions. In Mexico the changes in fiscal legislation, pricing and subdued consumer demand affect ed the market. Nescafé Dolce Gusto delivered double-digit growth across the region, while Dog Chow and Pro Plan drove sales in the petcare business.

Full Paragraph Text: Good performances in France, Switzerland, Austria and the Netherlands, and a recovery in Spain and Portugal sup ported the growth in Western Europe. The Great Britain region, Germany, Italy and Greece were more challenged. There were strong performances from petcare and Nescafé Dolce Gusto across Western Europe and we saw good growth from innovations in several categories. Highlights included Nescafé Gold and Azzera premium soluble coffee, Fresh Up and Buitoni Fiesta in frozen pizza, Maggi snacking noodles in ambient culinary and the launch of premium chocolate tablets Les Recettes de l’Atelier in France.

Full Paragraph Text: The slower growth in the Zone was due to our largest market China and to Oceania. In China we needed to adapt our portfolio to reconnect with the fast-changing expectations of the Chinese consumer. Therefore, in addition to correcting trade stocks throughout the year, we focused on innovation, on reformulation and on re-launches, particularly in coffee, ready-to-drink and confectionery. We continued to see good performances in ambient culinary, ice cream and ready-to drink coffee. In Oceania we are focused on developing new trade channels.

Full Paragraph Text: Strong growth continued in most other emerging markets, in particular the Philippines, South Asia, the Indochina region, Turkey and many markets in Africa. We introduced new premium noodles in Singapore and Malaysia. In the Philippines the new fortified Bear Brand milk powders were well received. It was also rolled out in Africa, helping to deliver good growth across the continent.

Furthermore, the relationship described ('would miss out on') is a conditional statement about a potential consequence, not an explicit causal link between two distinct spatial scales.

Full Paragraph Text: That’s why sustainability is at the heart of everything we do to ensure we have a viable long-term business that is attractive to investors.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses general business sustainability principles and investor attractiveness without mentioning any specific geographical locations, jurisdictions, or spatial scales. No cross-scale spatial interactions are present.
